rules.ruleString: (Must be enrolled in course version {2982, 2984, 2985, 2986, 3454, 3460, 3462, 3467, 3468, 3470, P4001} and For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {3454, 3460, 3462, 3467, 3468, 3470, P4001} Do Any 2 passed co-req units in {PGW1102, PGW1103, PGW5102, PGW5103, VCW1102, VCW1103} Otherwise true)

description: This unit provides students with a greater understanding and skills to effectively manage acute wounds such as surgical wounds, thermal injuries and traumatic wounds. Students will gain a broader understanding of techniques used to assess acute wounds, the role of infection, exudate production, and how to achieve better health outcomes, preventing complications, limiting scarring and restoring normal activities.
faculty: Faculty of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences
